body.PromptContent: Return the reputation for all the domains and IP addresses in this e-mail. besides https://security.microsoft.com/userSubmissionsReportMessage, include the sender domain (this should be the string that is coming after the @ sign)

body.Query: let email = EmailEvents | where Subject == '@{variables('OriginalSubject')}' and SenderFromAddress == '@{variables('OrignalFRomAddress')}' | project NetworkMessageId; let urls = EmailUrlInfo | join email on NetworkMessageId| project Url; UrlClickEvents| join urls on Url | summarize UsersWhoClicked = dcount(AccountUpn)

body.PromptContent: Check if we have MDTI articles associated the above indicators. Only return articles relevant to indicators in the e-mail. You must not return articles that are not relevant.

body.Subject: Your Phishing submited email Report - Results

body.PromptContent:
Above was an investigation performed by a security analyst to determine if an e-mail was a phishing attempt. As part of the investigation, we check against microsoft defender advance hunting logs who else from our organization received this email  by running this query 

EmailEvents
| where Subject == '@{variables('OriginalSubject')}'

and we got the above results:
@{body('who_got_this_email')?['Results']}


Than we checked in advance hunting defender logs, who else click on this email 
By running the above query 
            let email = EmailEvents
            | where Subject == '@{variables('OriginalSubject')}' and SenderFromAddress == '@{variables('OrignalFRomAddress')}'
            | project NetworkMessageId;
            let urls = EmailUrlInfo
            | join email on NetworkMessageId
            | project Url;
            UrlClickEvents
            | join urls on Url
            | summarize UsersWhoClicked = dcount(AccountUpn)

And received  the above results :
@{body('who_click')?['Results']}

Include the above results and Summarize this investigation with all the steps taken, share and decide if this is a phishing email. Share certainty percentage: if the email is not suspicious give it 0-30% if it medium suspicious give it 30%-74% and if its highly suspicious give it 75%-100%, you **must** include suspicious certainty percentage.

format the answer with bolt bpoints, like the baove example:


high level overview on the mail indictors including the sender domain, receiver, send time, message id:

Sender Email Domain: @{variables('OrignalFRomAddress')}
toRecipients: @{variables('OrignalTo')}
receivedDateTime: @{variables('orignalRecivedTime')}
id: @{items('For_each')?['InternetMessageId']}

MDTI Findings:
Add the MDTI finding, including articles and TI indictors  if you find.
Articles:
Article 1: Link to Article 1
Article 2: Link to Article 2
Threat Intelligence Indicators:
IP Addresses: 
URLs: 
File Hashes: 

Explain about who else receive this email and who else click on it:
Recipients and Click Activity:
Other Recipients: 
Click Activity:


Summary and Scoring:

Summarize the percentage scoring   
Phishing Email Score: 75%-100%
Risk Level: 
Recommended Action:

/AskGPT Triage the following email and point out what you find suspicious?when analyzing the email body Ignore this URL https://security.microsoft.com/userSubmissionsReportMessage. 
Investigate the messageId above for any inconsistencies or signs of spoofing. 

Use inputs: email body:@{body('Html_to_text')} , 
sender email@{variables('OrignalFRomAddress')}, 
Reciver email:@{variables('OrignalTo')}, 
Message-ID:@{items('For_each')?['InternetMessageId']}, 
emailSubject:@{variables('OriginalSubject')},
Email receivedDateTime:@{variables('orignalRecivedTime')}, 
importance:@{body('Parse_JSON')?['importance']}, 
Sender IP address:@{items('For_each')?['SenderIPv4']}, 
AuthenticationDetalies:@{items('For_each')?['AuthenticationDetails']}, 
* This above email is a user submitted phishing (meaning the reciver user click report button, and the email move to a shared mailbox to process by this auotmation ).
* During this process the orignal email came as attachment, base on this information  ignore the existence of the attachment during the analysis. 
* This email submited by the user, we will have discrepancy between the sender email vs the email from who recive from.ignire the mismatched Email Addresses.
In your answer use evidence from the email itsef in the analysis.

The above summarization finding is going to be send to the end user that reported about this email
Use the same investigation content in this summarization but target it to end user that is not technical.
Prepare your answer in an email form, with the recipient name is the audience of this email. format the output as HTML without any other token beside the html's tags

body.Query: EmailEvents | where Subject == '@{variables('OrignalFRomAddress')}' | summarize by SenderDisplayName, SenderFromAddress,  RecipientEmailAddress, SenderIPv4 , TimeGenerated

EmailEvents | where Subject == '@{variables('OriginalSubject')}' | where SenderFromAddress == '@{variables('OrignalFRomAddress')}' | project SenderIPv4, InternetMessageId, AuthenticationDetails, Timestamp
